relevant_findings.speculum_examination: closed cervical os, small amount of bright red blood, no pooling fluid

vital_signs.fetal_heart_rate: 140 bpm, moderate variability and accelerations, single deceleration with rapid return to baseline

relevant_findings.abdominal_examination: gravid, soft, mild tenderness on palpation at fundus
relevant_findings.speculum_examination: closed cervix, approximately 5 ml of dark brown blood

relevant_findings.uterine_examination: atonic uterus, brisk vaginal bleeding from the uterus

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient became unstable with brisk vaginal bleeding and underwent hysterectomy

relevant_findings.right_ventricular_function: evidence of acute right ventricular failure, right ventricular dilatation

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in right ventricular function noted after treatment with inotropic agents and inhaled nitric oxide
